Comments_List: Great introduction into the thought-world of Benjamin, with concepts such as the dialectical image, the collector-allegorist, decline of the aura etc., which have impacted my own way of thinking and which concepts I will keep thinking about for a long time afterwards.
Understanding patterns and themes in archival projects. Really getting into a different time period. Parsing though dense concepts and theory.

I could get a bit lost when Prof Sussman entered into lecture mode, but the little that did gain was precious. I loved how he would make the Arcades Project relevant to modern life, from the bourgeois structure of American football to his obsession with Douglas Hofstadter.
Absolutely. It's a shame that Sussman has retired.
